reviewText:
Cry of Fear is a Psychological First Person Shooter Survival Horror game taking place in Stockholm (F√§versholm ingame), Sweden.

Cry of Fear is my 2nd favorite game of all time. It only gets beaten by S.T.A.L.K.E.R. I love Cry of Fear so much because of the atmosphere, the sick and twisted horror or it might be because, and I can assure you that,  it is one of the best survival horror games I ever played for not being triple A. The atmosphere is one of the best ever accomplished in a video game as well. Only Silent Hill and Condemned or Amnesia being much higher on the ranking, or eteneral darkness, but what makes this games environment stand out is the brutal emptiness of the swedish city nightsky, the lonliness, the monsters and the madness playing around simon, the protagonist. It¬¥s depressing, oppressing, evil and obscure, something very unique even if nothing compared to condemned, suffering, etc... the great masterpieces of survival and horror. The story is simple but good even if the execution is sloppy and cringeworthy. Simon acts really naive and childish sometimes but grows with further developement of the story, establishing a good connection between the player and Simon. Depressed, full of emotional problems and self suppression, having problems of confessing his feelings for his crush, Simon is getting into an car accident, which changes his life forever. If you could throw ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• at someone, everyone would throw it at Simon. I don¬¥t want to spoil to much here so I simply want to say that this games story is mainly about suicidal, homicidal thoughts, depression, anxiety and some really dark psycho horror. It talks to people with mental issues, as well as it does show mentally sane people at least the realism inside the surrealism of being a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ed up individual. As you can see, a topic not everyone likes, that¬¥s why not everyone really liked playing the game for its story, or because the story was not speaking to some/most of the players, or they disliked the gameplay which is a taste on its own. For more look at the gameplay section of this review.
Not everyone like me or maybe you went through the same situations and thoughts as Simon. I can feel for him with all of my heart though. Give it a try and see for yourself. Make sure to be open enough for these topics though. You really have to try it out and give it a chance. It¬¥s based on the GoldSrc engine on which also Half Life 1 was running on. Team Psykskallar really made the best out of this old engine and you can clearly see it. Graphics are decent for what they can provide.


Horror, Gameplay, Puzzles, etc.:

You have a big variety of levels, from the typical subway station to the mental hospital and forest but also parks and sewers, subway maintenace bays, construction sites and apartements, a school, a very nice boat scene and more!
You have an inventory system like resident evil. You have to carefully pick and manage your equipment. It¬¥s kept more simple though. Weapon models are excellent, as are their animations and the sound design overall. Close Combat is clunky at the beginning but gets better and very smooth and satisfying after some time, as you figure out that GoldSrc is not good with melee weapons and thus the modder Andreas R√∂nnberg thought that a Dodge Button or double tap S or W, A or D could be quite useful and you start to adapt. Most people still don¬¥t know that, you can even disable it in the options completely. Some people though will never learn it or like it. It really is just improvised and clunky due to the problems that old engine puts up. Do not worry Mr.Shooter, usually after the apartements, as soon as you get your first gun, that should be after 40 mins, you change the playstyle anyway. From 100% melee to what ever percentage of combatstyles, due to ammo count, you want. You have to create your own technique of slash and dodge to succesfully kill your opponent when once run out of ammo due to ammo scarcity. Dodging is purely accomplished by exercising it. Ammo for guns can be scarce on normal and hard, not so much on easy.
Now to the horror. If you played Amnesia or Slender and you felt it was a walk in the park, then this game is nothing for you. It¬¥s between Resident Evil with a touch Silent Hill. It has some cheap jumpscares, good jumpscares, many jumpscares, either unpredictable or very predictable, depending on your experience with game design, level design, and games, especially horror games in general. If you fall into the horrorspiral and you start being scared by this game and a nice haunting paranoia scrawls up your skin, it seems like this game achieved what it wanted to achieve. The Paranoia and meaninglessness of the world in general will hit you. This game is pure shizophrenia and depression in one pill to go.
The soundtrack is one of the best in video games history, fitting perfectly to the games environment, characters emotional state and just the mood of the game, making it effective to build tension and depressiong feelings in the right moments. If you are a very emotional or sensitive person, you will love it. If you are a cold brick, better go back and play your casual games or tougher horror games with VR because CoF is really just a nice spooky ride and not a house of horror wanting you to ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• your pants. Those games are horror focused as with this game it uses horror as its style.
Some Puzzles"/Riddles can be frustrating and many parts can be hard to accomplish or are just pure adrenaline kicks (maze). As the maze is easy and requires the typical smart gamer skillset of good memory it can come over as if the game is badly designed or unbalanced. Yes

reviewText:
Pros and Cons here we go! Woot Woot!

What you'll love...
- The Story... It's really Enjoyable and Depressing (hey, it's a horror game) at the same time!
- The Gameplay... Excluding the confusing inventory, the gameplay is awesome! Survival Horror at it's best!
- The Soundtrack... One word: BEATIFUL! If you can, buy it! Support the devs and listen to this relaxing/scary/awesome soundtrack! (actually, there are 2 soundtracks!)
- The Co-Op... Yeah, i guess it's broken and you need to port forward or use Hamatchi, but when you actually get to play it, it's AWESOME!
- The Visuals... It's using a 1998's engine, but looks good by today's standards too! Psykskallar milked everything out of the GoldSource engine!

What you'll hate...
- Some Cheap Jumpscares only scary once or twice...
- Some low res Textures and graphical bugs (you won't notice them if you aren't trying to find them on purpose, hopefully)
- Difficulty curves, ya know... bosses and Sawrunner...
- Forgetting not to waste ammo (you lose unspent bullets if you reload with a non-empty magazine*)
- And of course... having to wash your underwear after playing this amazing Survival Horror game which will not only require you to change underwear, but sleep with the lights on for the next few days!

- Skandi007 Survival Horror Veteran

If this was a REVIEW (oh wait, it is) i'd give this game a 9/10, i really love it...There is some room for improvement... but i can live with that... :)

Likes:
I like that it had a different campaign for solo and multiplayer. Also that the multiplayer version was a continue of the first version. I LOVE that there was a survival mode. I liked that there were parts that weren't even meant to scare the player, yet they did. I like how the game had a good storyline. I also love that it was free! The game even ran well (most of the time) on my bad laptop! The game had some scary parts, but was not overly-abusive about the jumpscares and other scary stuff...

Dislikes:
I wish there was a create-your-own survival mode, even though I can understand that is back-breakingly hard to do... I at least wish the creator would've put more effort into the survival mode, making it easier in some way or less repetitive. The solo and multiplayer campaigns were VERY fun! However, there were some parts that annoyed me half to death. Some of the jump puzzles, the enemies that one shot you (sometimes), and least importantly... the enemy movement...
I'm currently STUCK on the first part of chapter six with an annoying jump-puzzle... It's annoying! I also wish there was an item, or something, that would give you more inventory space.

Overall:
The game was VERY good! There were some parts that were annoying and some things I wish existed, but with what the game has, it's GREAT!!! I give it 4.25 golden stars that don't exist anywhere, but my mind, but that counts for something ;)

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is simply the best Half-Life mod I have ever played, with the exception of Counter-Strike back in the day. This game shouldn't even be classified as a mod in my opinion. The engine has been utilized so well that there is little resemblence to the look of Half-Life.

Story:

The story of Cry of Fear is worth experiencing for sure. I like the mystery aspects to the story and your character's journey in figuring out what's going on. There are many WTF moments, which I like in survival horror games. Plus, there are mutliple endings, so the replay value is decent. I don't want to give anything away, so you willl have to check it out yourself. Definitely plays with the mind and is more of a psychological horror thriller than a straight up jump scare horror game, which in my opinion makes for a much more interesting experience.

Gameplay:

This game truly is survival horror and the designers understand how to make the player feel like every resource is valuable. Similar to games like the early Bioharzard (Resident Evil) or Silent Hill games, items like firearms, ammunition, light sources, health, etc. all become scarce quickly if not rationed correctly and you always feel relieved to find more. There are times where I decided to sprint past enemies instead of trying to take them out since I didn't have enough ammunition or they were heavy in numbers. Speaking of enemies, there is a decent variety to them and they are creepy as hell. The animations make them very disturbing, and the sound effects that belong to each of them unnerve your senses. As for the objectives, they are usually pretty simple for the most part. There is a lot of back tracking, but it does make sense within the story, so it didn't really become annoying. There were some areas where I got confused on where to go, but to me, this helps the experience more than hindering it. I don't always want to be told where to go or what to do so directly. Survival horror games should make you think for yourself. Most games lack this aspect. The firearms feel much more realistic  than most games. They have some serious recoil and the accuracy is fairly similar to the real thing, at least from my limited experience.

Graphics:

The game is very well polished for being built on such an old engine compared to the new ones. There are many details on the characters and enemies that bring out their personalities or lack thereof. Since this is a FPS with third person cutscenes mostly, the hands and weapons look very realistic. Very good details, especially on the firearms. The animations are done very well and the designers really didn't try to shortcut anything. Lighting, color, post processing, water, textures, etc. were all done very well, especially for a free game. The only gripe I feel anyone can make is only because of how old the engine is for the game, so obviously the polygon count isn't nearly as high as modern games. The settings are very detailed and make you feel like you are there in Sweden, which is where the game takes place. You are mostly in an urban environment, cautiously going through the streets, alleys, sewers, parks, buildings, etc. However, there are some other settings such as the forest and suburban areas.

Overall:

This game has accomplished everything it set out to do in my opinion. The sound design and music compliment the harsh disturbing atmosphere and really creeps you out, especially when you don't know what's around the next corner. The graphics are great for the resources used, the gameplay is true survival horror, and it's FREE!!! So, sit back, turn the lights off, turn up the volume, have a weapon near you along with a change of pants if need be, and enjoy this game. I would pay money to play this game, let's leave it at that.

My review is based on playing the single player only. I did not play through any other game mode. There is a co-op mode and a survivor mode as well, adding some more replay value.

5/5

reviewText:
I remember waiting for the mod to come out for months at a time. It just looked like it was going to be the greatest thing ever. An atmospheric survival horror that let you fight back, just like Silent Hill or Resident Evil. Except this one is in the first person! At the time, I thought it was going to be one of the greatest single player mods ever. And that's exactly what we got.

Graphically, this game goes beyong what the GoldSrc engine seemed to be capable of. The use of filters and high poly models, various graphical effects and I was blown out of my seat when I saw that water. This certainly isn't a bad looking game, even from a design standpoint. Even though the game is dark and dreary, the locations really felt like how they were supposed to. It really felt like I was wandering the city streets, or getting lost in the forest at night, or breaking into abandoned buildings. It was a genuine feeling that most games don't have today even with their emphasis on detail.

The gameplay wasn't god awful but it still made you feel hindered. You had to take your time aiming and be careful with your shots to conserve ammo. Sometimes you'd have to abandon certain weapons because you couldn't carry all of them including the key items, but there was that chance you could back track and pick up that weapon later. What I liked the most is that the use of things such as sprinting and using the sights on your guns fit in with the game well. Sure, it slowed down the game but regarding your ammo, that felt necessary. The enemies are great, too. Each with their own unique set of skills and abilities as well as their macabre designs. It fits in with the game's abandoned otherworldly atmosphere perfectly.

The game isn't even that short, either. In fact, it's pretty lengthy for a mod and rivals some AAA titles in terms of length and content. as you can see from my hours, it took me a while to beat this game because I felt like I needed to take my time with it. Having to go back and get weapons, dying to things I wasn't familiar with, struggling with puzzles, it felt like a game that would have stood its ground against the likes of the survival horror greats. The story is strange and, for some reason, it's logical as to why everything's so messed up.

You even have a bunch of stuff to unlock. It's mainly hoodies, but it's still something you can strive for in your multiple playthroughs, especially if you're looking to challenge yourself on the harder difficulties. It has multiplayer too, which is done in such a way that acts as a sequel. It does re-use the maps so that's a bit disappointing. The game itself is so good that it warrants a second playthrough just to experience the game again. Oh, and mods. There's mods for this game and they're not that bad either.

After it's all said and done, I take a look at the game's development on ModDB and I can't help but think; This game was the last hurrah for GoldSrc mods. There hasn't been a GoldSrc mod to come out in recent years that had anywhere near the amount of hype this game had. It was played to death by let's players, it was critically acclaimed by the community, it was a beautiful thing to come out of this veteran mod team, being that these are the same guys who also made Afraid of Mosters, another brilliant GoldSrc mod. These are memories that I'm most likely not going to have again, anticipating for this mod as if no other game in the world mattered and the conversations that would ensue between my friends as we played it through on the day of its release made the experience all the more memorable. That was a little over three years ago, but the memories are still fresh in my mind.

tl;dr, PLAY THIS GAME NOW.

reviewText:
Great game with a lot of problems. It's basically just elements from other survival horror games all rolled into one, but it doesn't really mix them all seamlessly. Also the main portion of the game is a fetch quest where you're going back and forth between large areas looking for a couple of items.

Inventory management is very strict as well so you often have to drop very useful items just to keep the game progressing. I also wonder if the voice acting is bad on purpose?

As a horror game it excels. Atmosphere, sound, design, everything looks and plays great but it's just very unfufilled in terms of gameplay. This is a free mod developed by a small team so you've got to give it credit for that, but just don't believe all the hype, this is a game with a lot of issues.

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is a mixed bag. The game and pretty much everything about it is fantastic, with one glaring flaw: the drawbacks of using an engine as old as GldSource with so many modifications is that this game will crash. A lot.

This wouldn't be such an issue if you weren't relying on savepoints, but *SPOILERS AHEAD* I got stuck in the train tunnels where you have to use the flares because it managed to crash three times in a row at about the point where you get to the doctor. At that point I gave up. But if it says anything, it is good enough I'm likely going to try to get it to work tomorrow. If you are somebody who despises any game with the potential of losing progress due to poor mechanics, then maybe you should pass this up.

Other than the stability issues, this is a superb game and it scared me quite a few times. I loved the inventory system, if I had one complaint about it, keys shouldn't count as items. I know it may be a 'drop a weapon so you can progress' kind of game at times, but the only effect taking up my inventory with keys has is making me backtrack for the sake of getting back certain weapons I had to drop to pick up some keys.

The music provided the perfect tone for every environment you can imagine, and was so good that it could create effective tension even in a room that is completely empty except for the player. I had a very nice time with this one, one of my all time favorite horrors in general.

I'd recommend any fan of the genre pick this up if you have the time to get it working properly.

_____
EDIT: Got it to work and have beaten the game twice. The story and visual beauty is so compelling that I'd recommend you continue playing even if you do experience frequent crashes.

Final Score:

9.5/10

reviewText: This game, like many other games, has gameplay. You can move, you can look around, and occasionally, fire a gun. It has graphics. It has lighting effects. It has a decent color pallet. It is also free to play, so you can't go wrong. It has a story unlike any other. It has enemies to combat. It also has allies that can help you on your quest. Unlike a lot of games nowadays, it has varied, thematic, set pieces. Don't let the title fool you, you won't be crying in fear, you will be crying about how amazing of an experience you've had, absolutely free, so you can save the money for passover. The movement is pretty dynamic. If you walk into a hard surface, you will stop. No longer will you have that lingering feeling that at any moment, you will fall through the floor. Oh, I forgot to mention that this game has a very engaging, and cinematic co-op experience. Each moment in co-op is unlike any other before it. You and your friends will experience a truly heart-wrenching, claustrophobic, gut-pounding, bowel movement-inducing, spoop filled catastrophe. Never has there been a more immersive co-op experience. The indie aspect truly shines throughout the many epic, magnificent, unanimous, diverse, open world realms. The only downside, and I truly regret to have to report on this, is the complete lack of an in depth character customization. Without a feature as crucial as character customization, I FEAR that this game will be overlooked by many. I CRY at the very thought that this game will go unnoticed. It is with all of my heart, that I recommend this game to everyone who enjoys a fast paced, adrenaline fueled, ride into the mind of the developers. Brace yourself for the emotional rollercoaster, and try not to CRY when you reach the end.

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is a psychological single-player and co-op horror. You play as a young man, Simon, desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness.
The single player campaign claims to take about eight hours time.
There is also another secret campaign after beating the first, then a completely separate co-op campaign, and multiple custom campaigns along with a custom campaign and map creator that is intuitive and easy to use.
The gameplay is like most survival horror games. You do have a backpack and your pockets but you cannot carry everything, forcing you to make sacrifices on what you want to carry and what you need to carry.
Cry of Fear's atmosphere is great, the dark corridors, the creepy forests to a tight packed school, the environments are varied and have a great way of getting you in the mood and into the game. Another aspect of the atmosphere in sound, Cry of Fear has a wonderful soundtrack with scary, dark tracks and beautiful melodies.
Cry of Fear was a Half-Life 1 mod that turned into a full free game. I  recommend it to everybody who loves horror games. You will not get anything better for free.

Sounds 9/10
Graphics 7/10
Gameplay 8/10
Atmosphere 10/10

reviewText:
I'll start by saying, if you're a horror fan you have no reason not to at least try this game. Its free and has a gripping and quite lengthy story driven campaign. Thats not to mention it also has a seperate coop campaign and even tools to make your own custom campaigns.

You follow a teen called Simon, a deeply troubled soul who for some reason gets caught up in a car accident. Upon his awake, he realises he's been left abondoned in unfamiliar territory only equipped with his mobile phone and pocket knife. Many questions have now been raised; How and why is he is here? How he did get away unscathed? Who and what are these shadowly figures that keep appearing around each new corner?

The game pretty much plays like any other survival horror game. You control SImon from first person view and move from A to B collecting various items and solved puzzles along with way. The atmosphere here is perfect and is only made better with the chilling soundtrack. Even though it can look a little dated now (which is probably down to this being a Half-Life 1, Source Gold engine mod to be fair), this seems to only help with the creepy factor. I do get a sense that this game was heavily influenced by the Silent Hill series due to the settings and surreal nature of the gameplay but again this is by no means a bad thing. It contains a plater of jump scares, some cheap and some less so but these are all well mixed with some very unique experiences.

Thats not to say the game doesnt have its problems. Some of the combat can be far too frequent at times giving it a repetitive feel. The maze-like map design can get confusing causing you re-tread many a room unnecessarily. Also the game does have tech and bug issues. I've had a number of crashes and random glitches but these were thankfully few and far between.

Overall, I throughly enjoyed this and it has some excellent work on show. Its only a shame these guys wont get at least something in return for this. Highly recommended.

reviewText:
It's definitely a great game. It's better than most AAA titles and although this is just a mod, it's something very special. It has a well thought out story, nice combat and I can see that the developers definitely put a lot of effort into this. Literally every place, every boss fight and every monster has a relevance towards Simon and somehow reflects a part of his own life/state. I just want to say a bit about the story. It's based around Simon's life and his depressions and anxiety and how it develops and how he develops with it. You're basically trapped in your own nightmare that's building up due to your depressions and anxiety. I personally love this story. If you look carefully at certain elements of the game you'll find hints and clues that he's trapped inside his own nightmare and that he's suffering from severe depressions, caused by an accident.

I would tell you more about the game and its story, but I don't want to spoil it for you.

reviewText:
I played this game on my old steam account back in the day. This game is one of those gems that define real survival horror. You'll probably need to go shopping for new pants after you're done with this game, assuming you'll have the balls to finish it all the way to the end. This game is very well made. The story is very engaging and the suspense and horror factor in this game is nothing to joke about. The graphics may be outdated by today's gaming standards, but give this game a try and you will not regret picking it up and adding it to your gaming library. In fact, this beats out most survival and horror games on steam...and this one is free! I would have gladly paid for this game for its full price without the need of a steam sale when I first discovered it. It was a godsend that the developer of this game decided to make it free. To show my support for this game, I shall list down an honest review of what I believe the game has made me experience.

PROS:

- For a game that was based on the old Half-Life engine, it is very well made and polished.
- The horror factor in this game is unquestionable. You like getting your pants soiled constantly? Play this game.
- The story is quite engaging and is a realistic take on people who suffer from the particular illness the protagonist is going through.
- Realistic atmosphere and creepy environment adds to the horror factor of the game.
- Classic game, one that will keep you on the edge of your seats the whole time.
- Ever played Silent Hill? This game is pretty much on par with it.
- This game has the most disturbing and creepy looking enemies you will face.
- Online co-op.

CONS:

- There are some areas in the game that are VERY dark by design, even with the flashlight. You might wanna boost your brightness settings a little bit.
- Controls may feel a little clunky at first, but overtime, you'll get used to it and it will seem more fluid as the game progresses.
- PewDiePie once did a LP of this game. I rest my case.
- The save system and inventory is a little bit troublesome to navigate through and get used to, but like the others, you will get used to it as you progress more with the game.

I love horror games even though sometimes I don't have the balls to play them. I'll give this game a solid 9/10.

I highly recommend it for both horror casuals and veterans alike.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nCry of Fear is an outstanding game, giving insight into the mind of a depressed teenager riddled with anxiety. For someone who is unfamiliar to these sorts of conditions this game may come off slightly hyperrealistic and only distorted for the horror aspect of the game, but that is not the case. Like a lot of other people, the main character's monsters all represent something he deals with in the real world, whether that being personal relationships, or his anger towards the world in the first place. Not only is the story solid, but the game play is easy to follow, yes there are times you must go back through an area you've already seen, but in doing so you begin to see how our main character sees everything as repetitive. The whole game is about the main character and what these depressing thoughts and anxiety riddled interations play a part in his life and what they do to him mentally. Cry of Fear is truley a step up from Team Psykskallar's orginal title 'Afraid of Monsters' not only in the horror aspect of the game, but story wise as well. Really hoping to see more titles from them soon.

reviewText:
This game made my friend crap himself on the introduction.
It's that scary.

Cry of fear is a single player and co-op game where you play as a guy who wakes up in an alley and has to find his way back home.

The story is absolutely amazing, and yet at the same time it will crush your fells like a bug.
Sure, this game is old, and is based on the HL1 engine, but who cares?! It's still as fun as ever.
And there's multiple endings, so you can play as many times as you want.

The co-op, in my opinion, is so much fun. You are cops who have teamed up to destroy the zombies/monsters that have invaded the town. I love the fact that at the start of the final level, it gives you VP70's, sledgehammers and shotguns.

So, if you're looking for a spoop, play this game. And then cry afterwards, because your feels are destroyed.
It's free, too. Bonus!

reviewText:
*** UPDATED ***

Cry of Fear is an interesting game not because of how it's done, but the fact that it's the only true survival-horror title we'll ever get in maybe a decade or so.

The team that made this game also made the Afraid of Monsters mod for Half-Life, which some such as myself feel this was an improvement over it. The atmosphere in itself is just dark, metallic, tense, and irks danger more often than not. The way the world is built around this is pretty damn good too, it does it right.

Unlike Afraid of Monsters where ammunition worked in the same way as Half-Life, this game does it tradionally, with there being a magazine counter rather than total rounds in reserve; any time you reload you dump all the rounds in the last mag, no ifs ands or butts about it, it's gone.

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.
Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home.
This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so. But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.
Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.

Pros
+Story Rich
+Great voice acting
+Amazing add-on maps
+Spooks all around!
+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival
+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easy
Cons
-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi
-difficult platforming sections
-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.

Total rating: 9.75/10

reviewText:
Well, this is really something else.

Before playing Cry of Fear I wasn't really into horror games - in fact, I don't think I ever played any at all with the exception of a bit of Amnesia and SCP: Containment Breach. The reason I downloaded CoF was because it was a mod for HL1, and I was having serious Half-Life withdrawal symptoms at the time (seriously, where is episode 3?). What I got was not only an encouraging introduction into the horror genre, but one of the best games I've ever played in terms of character, story and suspense.

In particular, the protagonist, a nineteen year old Swedish guy named Simon, really struck a chord with me. Before playing this game I was having some serious issues in my life, dealing with heartbreak and severe anxiety to name a few. I can't say much without spoiling the plot, but the mental trauma that he went through and the way he responded to it let me know that I wasn't alone with these problems. The immersive gameplay of CoF helped me a lot and allowed me to connect to the protagonist more than any other before.

But anyway. As far as gameplay goes, it's relatively simple - if you've HL1 or any other Valve-made FPS, you should have no problem learning the controls. Unique to CoF is the inventory system, in which you can store up to 6 items, and the ability to duel-wield specific weapons. The puzzles are also challenging without being ridiculously hard, and if you get stuck like I did on the park puzzle" with the statues then don't be afraid to look the answer up on Youtube.

One criticism though. In order to avoid cheating

reviewText:
Things I liked about Cry of Fear
Visuals were great for a goldsource game, I would forget it was half life 1 engine sometimes.
Animations are great, spooky enemies and stuff.
Monster design is extremely gruesome and great with the meaning behind each enemy making it even better.
Music and sound is superb
Little bits like the inertia and such is great
Game is long lasting and hard to forget
Nice nightmare scenes

Bad things
Biggest issue for me still is the inventory management. It has a resident evil 1 style layout (Aka keys take up a slot, just like an m16 or shotgun) and it would be fine if you didn't have to drop all weapons to carry the keys to the next area then run back and pick them up again.
I didn't like the character development for Simon or that one chick (Cant remember her name), they felt emotionless and boring.
Iron sights are useless and unneeded.
Certain segments easy and some stupid (Sawrunner v1)
The endings made me upset physically (except the great secret ending)
Multiplayer was tough to get set up
Lose half your already ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• inventory and all weapons 3/4's into the game
Simon has asthma and cant run worth ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•

All in all I liked this game, I beat it when it was in beta still (Pre steam release) and I enjoyed it, past its flaws, and I would recommend it to any horror fan.

reviewText:
[Potential Spoilers!]
Cry of Fear is a psycological horror-shooter in an area similar to Stockholm, Sweden. You play as Simon, just some ordinary guy suffering from severe depression and what I think, due to the monsters, some schizophrenia. The game starts off with a segment of a man crawling towards Simon, uging for help, but Simon does not respond in kind and harms the man, bashing his head into a wall. Then there's a few fades to a blood-soaked padded cell, but the blood seems to spell something. Then the game cuts back to Simon, who stands around for a second before getting hit by an off-roading vehicle. Then there is some gameplay where you take pictures of the letter X that reveal a sinister plot and then a face screaming at you in the end.
Waking up in an alleyway with no recollection of what exactly happened before-hand armed with a (Slightly blood-stained) knife and a cell phone. Checking on his phone, he gets a text from his mother, urging him to come home, however; Simon cannot respond, as he has no service. (We all know that feeling, eh?) Then you embark on an adventure through the town on finding a way to get back home.
This is the introduction to Cry of Fear, originally a Half-life mod and later a full Steam release, which I will be reviewing because I have no clue what the difference is but if there is one, you're getting the Steam release. This game is made by the same dev team who made Afraid of Monsters: Directors Cut. Winning quite a number of Indie Game awards, and rightfully so.  But, just a fair warning, this game is grim and can cause nightmares.
Some things could turn one off about this game, such as dated graphics and a slightly odd control scheme.

Pros
+Story Rich
+Great voice acting
+Amazing add-on maps
+Spooks all around!
+Guns don't feel too over-powered and feel as though they're tools for survival
+Puzzles that aren't too difficult but aren't too easy
Cons
-MP is difficult to operate without Hamachi
-difficult platforming sections
-monsters are a bit difficult if that's a con to you.

Total rating: 9.75/10

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is probably one of the best Half-Life (1) mods to date. Yes that's right, it's a Half-Life (1) mod!
It's incredible what the developer/s have done to push the limits of the now ancient (but still amazing) GoldSrc Engine. The graphics are simply brilliant, may not resemble your modern day glorious shooter but the graphics showcase and create a eery and horrific atmosphere. There are other cool features such as the ability to duel wield, explore, sort out and store with an inventory system and use items in a more interesting and complex way other than the original Half-Life.
Cry of Fear also supports custom campaigns (which is awesome!) and has an SDK for fans and modders to make their own disturbing adventure!
The atmosphere this mod/game creates is chilling and each corridor, corner, and shadow will have your hair raised and goosebumps rising by the numbers. A truely disturbing and great physcological horror game with a very immersive storyline too!

7.5/10

reviewText:
One of the best survival horrors out there. The influence of Silent Hill (especially 2) is clearly visible on both gameplay and theme, but capturing that kind of atmosphere and mood can only be a compliment, A huge one. And worry not because Cry of Fear does have a really strong identity of it's own.
The limitations of the Gold Source engine are barely noticeble due to just how much the original game was modifyed, however, like Half Life, Cry of Fear also changes gameplay mechanics from times to times, depending on the scenario you're in. For a horror game, Cry of Fear does this tremendously well, and except for a few moments of the game (like the falling train sequence) the game manages to use the change of it way of playing as a way of provoking fear into the player rather than frustration, since from a moment to another you will be forced to think in a different way if you want to progress.
The story like I said earlier, is incredibly influenced by Silent Hill, however, it is obvious that alot of it came from the creator's life experiences. One thing I must criticize is that not all monsters seem to represent imidiatly Simons guilt and fears, some of them are just twisted and disturbing for the sake of being twisted and disturbing, but, while they dont offer much in terms of the main characters' psyche, they do offer more variety of gameplay, since Cry of Fear does have many diferent types of enemies. All I can say plot-wise is that it takes it's time to reveal what's actually going on, and the closer you get to the truth, the more twisted and nightmaqrish the visuals of the game will become, to express the depression and suicidal tendencies of the protagonist.
The gameplay is filled with subtle details that are mostly overlooked even by the greatest of the surival horror genre, wether old or new. The presence of those elements only make this game grimmer and genuinly terrifying, since they add depth to the game, and you will have to consider their use if you want to survive due to the scarce resources.
I was also incredibly impressed due to the quantity of bonus material. You get a bunch of new game modes, extra weapons, developer commentary, diferent outfits, trophys, pages of Simon's book, and also, parts of the game switch simply by starting new playtroughts. For example, codes for specific doors change so you cant simply resort to online help to solve a puzzle. There are also TONS of easter eggs in the game, 4 diferent endings on the main singleplayer, theres multiplayer and 4 different difficulty settings. Also, props to the sound design and music, it's also great.

For a free game this is absolutly amazing, and for such a small team of developers... Then my god you guys have created a masterpiece. It is one of the scariest games I've ever played, dont let the terrible jumpscare screamer at the beginning reflect how the rest of the game is gonna be. And if you like Cry of Fear, then I highly recoment Afraid of Monsters as well, but that one you will have to install like a regular Half Life mod. This game, at least for me, proved that both game with combat or without combat can be just as scary as one another, taking diferent routes for their game design.

So, if you are a horror fan, why arent you playing Cry of Fear yet?

reviewText:
When I first downloaded Cry of Fear on my Steam, I thought I wouldn't be that scared by it seeing as I laugh at retro graphics (and all of the enemies you come across in the first Half Life game).

However, I was wrong.

The game's only elements of fear are from its jumpscares and they are pretty damn terrifying. I no longer require sleep anymore (but who needed that anyway?).

The graphics are kinda old looking but that makes the game even worse because it causes the enemies to look more grotesque than a realistic game would. I prefer playing retro games anyway and I always find non-realistic looking games to look and play much better.

On the whole, a terrifyingly-poopdedoop yourself- enjoyable experience and I highly recommend this game if you enjoy survival horror games, like Half Life mods (or are constipated).

reviewText:
This review was to come earlier than it did today, but I dropped my peanut butter jar into the socket wire which resulted to, yanno. Shutdown. Curse that.

''Cry of Fear is a psychological single-player and co-op horror game set in a deserted town filled with horrific creatures and nightmarish delusions. You play as a young man desperately searching for answers in the cold Scandinavian night, finding his way through the city as he slowly descends into madness.''

I've seen my most fear, in this game. Therefore, it's one of the scariest games out there. Not only scary, but it gave me a huge impact of depression. A lots of depression. Not that point where I would kill myself, but this is kind of traumatic to young people like me. If you mind I'm 15, before you think it's a 9. :P

Sure it was fun to play cooperative with friends, shoot zawmbeez, and monsters like L4D. I was mistaken, once. There was this map which scared the hell outta me, and I would just want to quit the game even there's a friend. two at most. It caused aa lot of depression and illusion to me, like you see big bloody hands, chains, bloods all around, tentacles, hanged men and women, question marks, and stuff. The soundtrack makes it even more spooky.

It's just.. Can't play on that map, again.

On the other hand, however, I didn't want to play the campaign even if it's the main point of the game. Note that, I am a 'scaredyshroom' guy, who never wanted to play alone. Though, playing campaign is 2x kook-the-spookier than that of Co-Op. 10/10 did not play and won't play.

Let's take out the 'Serious Sam' outta this review and talk about the verdict!

The Verdict

The Good:
-Cooperative
-Sucessful scaring
-Simon's realistic stuff
-Simon's hood looks like an assassin's
-Cleverly eerie soundtrack

The Bad:
-Glitchy
-Buggy
-Buggy everything
-Buggy menu
-Buggy menu
-Another BUGGY MENU!!
-Buggy buttons
-Crashes everytime for a slight reason
-When it does all these, 10/10 you would launch for a scan for Viruses

The Ugly:
-The way Simon shoots himself
-Cannot jump over stuffs
-You'll often run out of ammo which gives you alot of scarcity

Those bugs were a huuuge letdown for this game so:

Recommended for those how want to have some spooky time!


7.6/10

reviewText:
This game is terrifying to play by yourself. Of course, that's part of the fun.

I liked how there are other game types other than just the campaign, and the campaign itself has good replayability. You can go back and find all the secret nuggets hidden about, and unlock in-game items. Gameplay is smart and realistic, like how I had to sacrifice a light source to use a knife and gun in both my hands. This isn't a game you play for stunning graphics, but I enjoyed the enemy designes; especially the pregnant woman with the baby clawing at you from her stomach. I had to take a break after that one to calm down.

The only things I have against it are the jump scares and multiplayer.

If you don't do so well with scary shnikey popping out of nowhere nearly constantly, you may have difficulty playing this game. There were many times when I thought I was going to have a heart attack, one right after the other. It opens up a big bag of nope for me. It's like the game relies too heavily on that tactic. Well, that and rediculously fast hostiles that make you panic and get yourself killed.

For multiplayer the option is there, but it is practically nonexistent. There is no server upkeep, so I was forced to download seperate programs to try it out. I had to create a profile for different clients and host a room that lasted only a day. Once I got in a game it was actually pretty fun, with up to four players and multiple choices for game-types. Setup is just a pain in the backside.

All the pros and cons aside, free is free. If you want to be scared this halloween, or any other time of the year, it is worth playing with the lights out and headphones at full volume.

reviewText:
Get a friend and get ready for some cheap spooks!
No, but really, this game is broken, glitchy, weird, with bad graphics and somewhat badly recorded sounds.
If this game would have been somewhat good, like texture based or audio based, with better jumpscares and better coop support so you don't have to reconnect after every second loading....Honestly, I would have not played it.

This game has something. Something that I cannot explain. You can call it a charm or something. I really enjoyed the campaign (I am a liar, I quit right at the start because They told me there would be a jumpscare), but the coop.... Maaan the coop.

Where should I start? The coop is a pain in the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. It keeps disconnecting the one that is not hosting the game after every first/second loading, you cannot save, but only start from the chapters start, so you better not ragequit, it isn't much long, only 5 chapters and so on. I could talk days about the problems of this game, but I won't. I swear that I have never, ever in my life had so much......fun.

Let me tell you how it all started.
-Okay, we're in the game, two cops on a mission huh? Nice.
-Meanwile my friend already has no ammo because he tried to shoot the door open.
- Something runs at him screaming, he is yelling to my headphones like crazy (Meanwhile I am trying to reconnect because there was a loading)
-Misses all his remaining bullets and kills it with his last few shots.
-Meanwhile I connect, start shooting like a mad man to kill the second ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• coming at us.
-We've got both of them.
-Friend is almost dead, we continue down the street.
-Unhuman scream
-AN UPSIDE DOWN BED THAT HAS SOMEONE ATTACHED TO IT AND IS.....FLYING?! (10/10 has flying beds - IGN)
-We both burst out laughing.
-I find some ammo and a syringe
-Try to give the syringe to friend, accidentally inject it myself. (10/10 would get high accidentally again - Me)
-Somehow manage to get through it both alive (I died cuz a BIG ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING TREE punched me and I flew like 500000 metres [Not lying] across the whole ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing map and then he ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• me vigourously, friend picked me up after)
-Get to a house.
-Search it whole.
-Oh a stairwell.
-What could possibly go wrong on a stairwell?
-GUESS WHAT, EVERYTHING!
-Friend tries to run up the stairs and the stairs broke down as he falls through them.
-SO MANY UNHUMAN SCREAMS (One of them my from my friend just because he got scared so hard)
-Jump down after him so I can save him like a mother‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing hero from his misery.
-Survives just barely.
...Yeah, that's just how our first session went because I went to bed after that.
Day 2
-Skipped the first chapter and went straight to the second just because we did not want to went through it again.
-Friend spawns in a apartment hall, I am still loading.
-Stars screaming as something is running right at him and then explodes.
-*I connect*
-Help him defeat all these unhuman enemies.
-He finds a shotgun and I find something like a bolt action rifle from ww2
-Go up the stairs.
-WTF IS THAT (screams my friends)
-WTF IS WHAT (I scream)
- Then I turn around and see a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing SOMETHING running at us, but it doesn't have arms, IT JUST HAS TWO ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING CHAINSAWS.
-Die like 15 times, almost at our peak of ragequitting, then finally kill him.
-Nice, start searching the apartment.
-Friend starts screaming like a girl again.
-Ask him WTF Happened.
-He described that he saw a m4a4 like weapon in a bathroom and when he ran up to it, that the floor broke and he fell down.
-Cannot find him, tell him that I am scared.
-Finally find ourselves.
-Move on.
-A ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing forrest?
-Nah, I am good.
That's just how our second session went.
We had two more, but I dont want to write anymore.

Okay, so overall, best game ever.
No seriously, In the term of best COOP horror game, I would say that this one is the best.
10 out of ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing 10 , would love to hear my friend and myself scream like a little girl again.

reviewText:
So, i guess its time for write a review for this awesome game.
Cry of Fear its an horror game developed by Team Psykskallar.
They also made the amazing Half Life 1 mod ''Afraid of Monsters''
which is also coming soon to Steam for free and it will include Co-op and
enhanced graphics.
Anyway, this game talks about Simon, a guy who was hurted by a car
and that it maked him paralyzed on a wheel chair.
After this crash anyway, you wake up on a street unconoscious, you must
find out what's happening and try to go back to ''home''... if you can still call it home uh.
Ok, i'm not gonna talk anymore about the Story.
Now instead, i will talk about some other things like the graphics etc...
The game runs on GoldSRC Engine (same Half Life 1 Engine) and the graphics are great for such an old engine!
Also, the game has a lot of scary enemy's like the ''Sawer'' which is... well, you will see with your eyes ;)
The game also has 2 co-op campaigns up to a max of 4 players + a co-op survival game mode.
So yeah, should you try out this game? Is it scary?
Yes and yes.
Its such a great scary game with lots of jumpscares.

reviewText: I'm not good at horror games. I'm rather good at the original Silent Hill though. Thats the kinda vibe this game gave me when I first played it. You wake up in a strange place with hardly any explanantion or anything and then *BAM* jumpscare. I first played this game at school with my friends, bad idea. The controls are solid. This game started as a mod for Half-Life so of course the controls are good. The graphichs look nice (a bit dated) and the film grain effect adds a nice touch of horror. I tried to play it, couldn't get past the opening. I don't really have any niggles with the game (haven't played much) but the loading times can take long and crash sometimes. When I first played it, I saw the task manager open at least 4 times. When it got running, it was rather freightining. I've tried to convince my mates to get it as it has CO-OP, but they don't like horror games. As we like to say: 3 spooky, 5 me. Its free so download it if you like horror, want to wet yourself or you're just insane. Haven't played enough to give a proper rating, but the game looks promising. For now its an 8/10 with a scare factor of 9/10.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Amazing graphics despite being done with the ( modified ) Half-Life engine - I've never thought it could do water reflections, specular bump-mapping, post-processing effects and rain ( never seen rain in the original Half-Life ).
- Jumpscares, although being used a lot, come with a lot of variants so I don't get tired of them. You'll never know what is waiting at the next corner.
- Sound and music design are quite good. There are a few silent sections, which I believe the developers did it on purpose. Like Akira Yamaoka said: Silence is also a sound."
- Tons of extra unlockables and custom campaigns after beating the main game
date:
and even the single player alone is more than enough for a free game ( +/- 8 hours ).

Cons:
- The limited inventory system can sometimes get a bit hilarious. For example
recommended:
a key and a spade takes up the same amount of storage ( 1 slot ).
- Sawrunner spots are quite predictable thanks to these save points. ( could fix this by implementing an auto-save system which saves game in the background without noticing the player about it ).
- Frustrating backtrack sections.
- Puzzles are irrelevant to the story being told. The same to item placements ( who the hell put ammo in the bus anyway? )
- Obstacles seem obvious to bypass

I haven't even gotten to my first savepoint.  I was laying here at night, in pitch blackness save for the dim light of my monitor when I thought I'd give this a try.

My heart nearly beat of of my chest within the first three minutes of play.  I must play more, but not until morning.  Great game so far.

Update: Over 3 hours later, I have managed to get through Chapter 1.  This is a brilliant and taxing game.  I find myself praying for savepoints - not because I'm afraid of being killed and having to start over, but so I can take a break.  If you're looking for real horror, this is it.  One thing to note, if you're playing on 64 bit windows, you will need the crash patch available online.

reviewText:
Game Reviews #2 Cry of Fear.

Apparently this is a mod that took 5 years to make with the old Half Life 1 engine.

reviewText:

* enemies that can instantly kill you
* enemies that can make you kill yourself
* no quick save
I've also tried the co-op play (though just over LAN so far) and found it to be highly entertaining.
All things considered this game gets 8 hammers out of 10.

reviewText:
Multiple Cries of Fear Cry of fear (for anyone who can't read the product info)- Is a psychological, first-person horror/survival game. Been there done that right? Haha... WRONG!
Designed and created by a small team out of Sweden, Cry of Fear aims to do what many other games in the genre attempt to do: Scare the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• out of you. However, Cry of Fear seems to be one of the few that ACTUALLY scares the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• out of you.
I will be breaking down this game into 5 parts: Presentation, Graphics, Audio, Ease of Use and Gameplay followed by a verdict for anyone who wants the skinny on Cry of Fear.

Presentation
From the moment you enter the world of Cry of Fear (abv .CoF), it's clear that things are FUBAR. I won't give away too many details regarding the story as that is something you should experience for yourself, especially the intro.... ANYWAYS! You play as a seemingly young aged man(SImon) who is in desperate need of the worlds' best psychologist.  Simon(you) arrive in a city with no real recollection of how you got there. Armed only with your mobile phone and a switchblade, its up to you to brave the dark city and uncover what secrets it may hold.
Yeah
date: yeah dude get on with the review!" Meh...\nI have to say I love the atmosphere that this game presents. (Despite being on a much older engine; see Graphics) The archaic design of the city walls
hoursPlayed: many doors create a much needed level of immersion that is all too uncommon in most horror games. "Okay cool but aren't most horror games like that?" Yes! However this is much more expanded upon than the oh-so-common jumpscare-filled
voteText: corridor runners of late. You actually have to explore and figure where the hell you are and where you are supposed to be going. You literally feel lost in a city. IMMERSION.\nMenus aren't anything to gawk over. Simple in design but get the job done. In-game menus(inventory) have more detail and have a nice layout. Nice touches here and there (i.e. limited inventory space
votesHelpful: notepad) make the game seem more realistic in a sense. Most items in game have design features that constatly reminds you; This is a horror game and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• is about to hit the fan. Simple presentation
votesTotal: yet effective for what the game is trying to accomplish. I find it awesome that this game started off as a mod for Half-life 1 and is now a full standalone product. Go indie developers! Oh yeah and this one has co-op too
votesFunny:
so you and a few friends can enjoy the screams together!!! Granted you can get it working...
9/10

Graphics
So this is the area of the game that has received the most criticism
commentsCount: and with fair reasoning. The game itself runs on a modified version of the Half Life 1 Engine. This game however

Audio
"What the hell is that sound!? WHAT THE F*** is that!"

column26: creepy hallway sounds and the soundtrack all go a long way towards constantly keeping you on your toes. Ease of Use
Here is where I am going to talk a little smack on the game. Now

reviewText:
Reasons why this is one of the best indie horror games I've ever played:
1.This is a Half Life 1 mod, but you can clearly tell that new elements had been carefully coded in, by a group of 6 people.
2.This is not the typical Slender clone you'll usually see, it has a great plot and doesn't rely on thosands of jumpscares.
3.This game is amazing at getting reactions out of you. Sometimes it had me in disbelief, other times it had me scared out of my mind.
If you want an exceptional horror game with simple controls and a stellar storyline, but don't have a lot of cash, then I strongly reccommend giving Cry of Fear a try. That is, if you dare.

reviewText:
After patching the game for my old computer(a laptop), I finally got this to actually work(crappy computers not advised) so here is the basic list of the game's pros and cons:
PROS:
- Very clean inventory system
- Ability to make your own maps
- Different endings(watched these on YouTube)
- Multiple weapons and items like flashlights
- Very distinct bosses
- Disclaimer at the beginning of opening the game up
- VERY SCARY
CONS:
- No players on multiplayer
- Not alot of custom maps(maybe download off of ModDB?)
- Give's players power, which makes the game less scary.
- Some bosses are way too easy to beat(I won't tell you how to beat the first boss).
CONCLUSION:
Out of all the pros and cons, pros dominated the table and I am proud to call this game a horror game because of its darkness, its grief, and what it means to be in a psychopath's mind is like(Hint Hint).

reviewText:
Cry of Fear is still better than most of it's genre, and it's free.

Instead of relying on easy spooks and a lot of gore, CoF delivers horror in moments like being lost in a pitch black cellar when you hear someone starting a chainsaw, or walking in a building that you thought was deserted when you hear quick tapping of footsteps from behind you. The atmosphere is sultry and thick from the beginning, and the fear might not leave you after you've stopped playing.

I thought of myself being experienced in horror, but Cry of Fear surprised me positively. It made my skin crawl so badly it hurt, and I'm looking forward to experience it all over again.

reviewText:
WARNING : DO NOT INSTALL THIS GAME IF YOU ARE EASILY SCARED OR HAVE A SENSIBLE HEART.

Ah.. what can I say about this lil' indie horror-game gem?

Cry of Fear is a horror indie game which has a inmersive as impressing atmosphere which will make you feel like you're Simon (The protagonist), a 19 year old who writes things that are happening to him in a book.

It's a must-play really, especially if your a horror games fan like me.

The game itself has decisitions which you can take (like for example killing a determinate boss or not) that will affect the story's ending and events.

The only real problem with this game is that you will need to port forward or either use Logmein Hamachi to create a multiplayer server, due to the game does not come integrated with a system to host one like Left 4 Dead 2's one.

My final veredict is a 9.5/10 as it's pros and cons will be specified below.

Pros :

-Has a awesome multiplayer campaign taking the role of 1-4 cops who they attempt to find Simon and save him from all these monsters he created.

-Loads of monsters to battle, as some challenging bosses too.

-Amazing story and stages.

-Has unlockables that are hard to unlock but are worth it.

-Has 5 endings, all creatively created. (7 if we count both the unlockable character's story mode and the multiplayer one)

-Somewhat curious character.

-You have a unlockable that will let you play in ANOTHER different campaign as a character that helps Simon out in the original story (Don't want to spoil it entirely.)

Cons :

-Multiplayer requires port forwarding or LogMeIn Hamachi to play with friends and since the master server list is broke, you will need to open up the console and type in it connect" (without quotes) and the IP of the server to join it (E.g : connect 190.245.78.75:27015)"

reviewText: If you've ever wanted any game to stress you out to the point where you have to endure actual physical pain, believe me, this is what you are looking for. This is the perfect game for you traditional survival horror fans out there who enjoy a challenge while having to change your pants a few times and then, directly afterwards, visit your therapist. reviewText: I don't want to give this a bad review and there's no middle between that and a good, so I'll just give it a good review because it wasn't overall bad. As someone who is an avid fan of horror games, I checked this game out after seeing good recommendations from other people. What I got from this game was a bit disappointing as I thought I would get more than a few jump scares. It showed a bit of promised during the intro and the first 5 minutes into the game, and I admit it was a little bit nerve racking in the first few minutes into it, but as soon as I got used to the atmosphere, I got bored of it and was craving for more. It didn't live up to my expectation. The enemies are dull and not at all terrifying to the point that I just run around the game hacking and slashing enemies as though I was in a knife fight with a COD player.\n\nHowever, again, this isn't an overall bad game. Maybe I'm just so used to the horror genre that I expected way too much from a free game. People should still check it out because it is still worth checking out.

reviewText:
I haven't even gotten to my first savepoint.  I was laying here at night, in pitch blackness save for the dim light of my monitor when I thought I'd give this a try.

In retrospect, that was a bad time to start.

My heart nearly beat of of my chest within the first three minutes of play.  I must play more, but not until morning.  Great game so far.

Update: Over 3 hours later, I have managed to get through Chapter 1.  This is a brilliant and taxing game.  I find myself praying for savepoints - not because I'm afraid of being killed and having to start over, but so I can take a break.  If you're looking for real horror, this is it.  One thing to note, if you're playing on 64 bit windows, you will need the crash patch available online.

reviewText:
Does a game need the most up to date graphics, have a lot of gore and to be expensive to be great?
The answer is no, and the proof is Cry of Fear.
I have never had a better horror game experience in a game than this, the cold and raw streets of Stockholm with all kinds of scary hallucinations and monsters make this game the best.
With a deep story combined with the survival part it surely gives the player something to think about during the gameplay and after.
Recommend this game to every fps/horror player out there, you will surely have a great gaming experience.

reviewText:
Warning, spoilers below.

Well, I've had this downloaded for a few days and decided to give it a try. I launched it the first time only to run into issues with the way my computer is set up in terms of allowing new programs to run. Took about 5 minutes to clear those up, and launched the game again. Immediately, I was drawn in by the amount of effort put into creating cutscenes that felt like something a big studio would put out and found myself rather intrigued. Then, things took a strange turn. Armed with only a camera, I started to navigate my way through the first area. The darkness made things problematic, I hoped the whole game wouldn't be like this. I kept going, and started feeling comfortable. Surely there was nothing to be afraid of? The other denizens of Steam are not the hardened veterans of horror I thought they were. How wrong I was.

I clicked another little glowing X and what appeared to be a bloody severed head screeched at me as if it's bowels were being extracted with red hot pincers. This had the desired effect, I jumped about a foot in the air, my mouse hand moved wildly as if I had been electrocuted and I muttered F****n' S**t!" with little regard for anyone who may have been nearby. Thankfully
date: my pants remained unsoiled and I was alone. It was then that my character woke up. I explored a little after pausing the game for a moment and letting my heart rate settle and found the code to the padlock. I was concerned for my safety
recommended: but I boldly pressed onward until I found the first tape recorder. At this point
hoursPlayed: I saved my game and decided to write up this review warning others about the sheer terror that Cry Of Fear brings.\n\nIn closing

reviewText:
Imagine, if you will, Resident Evil 1. Now remove the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ty tank controls and replace them with first-person view and a control scheme more like Half-Life, with the addition of a dodge mechanic allowing you to jump in any direction at a moment's notice. Instead of a mansion, picture an entire city and its infrastructure, overrun with inexplicable horrors you will eventually come to understand the nature of. Instead of an elite police task force in over its head, imagine a young man barely out of high school, all alone, with nothing but a pocket knife and a cell phone with no signal.

Welcome to Cry of Fear.

The game is a blend of FPS combat mixed with borderline point-&-click puzzles, with each new building or area of the city necessitating some puzzle to be solved, some item to be tracked down, all while trying to survive the wide variety of things trying to kill you. The story is actually interesting, and I found myself pleasantly surprised as I neared the end, and the desire to play it over for a fresh perspective was aided by the myriad of challenges you can complete for NG+ gear to aid in your survival, as well as community made mini-campaigns for a breath of fresh air.


Positives:
+Challenging gameplay
+Oppressive, unnerving, and eerie level design
+Interesting story
+Good replay value
+Alternate co-op campaign
+Good length SP campaign

Negatives:
-Dated graphics (Negligible unless your name is Totalbiscuit)
-Sub-par VA work can really take you out of it
-Needs an extra patch to work with 64-bit systems
